intro: Bulbostylis lacunosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering stems bear small, spike-like clusters of pale green to brownish flowers. Bulbostylis lacunosa is often overlooked due to its modest size but plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
